Legal.privacy_policy_subtitle: Your privacy is fundamental. We are committed to protecting your identity and not using invasive trackers.
Legal.intro_p1: Welcome to Ideological Atlas. This Privacy Policy describes how we handle your personal information. By accessing our services, you agree to these practices.
Legal.intro_p2: Our mission is to map ideologies transparently. We do not trade your data nor use hidden tracking techniques.
Legal.col_account_desc: We collect basic data such as your name, email address, and language preferences when you register to create a personalized account.
Legal.col_interaction_desc: We record your answers to ideological questionnaires, your markers in the atlas, and the time spent exploring different information nodes.
Legal.col_tech_desc: We automatically collect information about your device, IP address, browser type, and operating system to optimize the visual experience of the Atlas.
Legal.col_contrib_desc: Any content you voluntarily post in community forums or comments on specific nodes will be publicly visible.
Legal.usage_intro: We do not sell your data to third parties. We use information exclusively for:
Legal.use_algo_desc: We analyze anonymous patterns to refine positioning.
Legal.use_perso_desc: We adapt suggested content to your results.
Legal.use_sec_desc: Protection against abuse and account notifications.
Legal.cookies_desc: We use strictly necessary cookies and local storage to manage your session and authentication securely. We do not use third-party cookies for advertising tracking.
Legal.cookies_note_text: The 'access_token' and 'refresh_token' cookies are essential to keep you logged in when you reload the page.
Legal.rights_intro: We guarantee the following rights regarding your personal data:
Legal.right_access_desc: Request a copy of all the data we hold about you.
Legal.right_rect_desc: Correct any inaccurate or incomplete information in your profile.
Legal.right_del_desc: Request the total deletion of your account and associated data ("Right to be forgotten").
Legal.right_port_desc: Receive your data in a structured format to transfer it to another service.
Legal.contact_desc: If you have questions about this Policy or wish to exercise your rights, contact us. We respond within 48 hours.

hero.title: Beyond Left and Right
hero.subtitle: An open-source initiative to dismantle biased diagrams and build a transparent, rigorous standard for political measurement.

story.title: Our Story
story.content_p1: Ideological Atlas was born in late 2025 out of frustration with circular political discussions. We realized complex thinkers were forced into simplistic labels because obsolete tools like the Nolan Chart couldn't represent them.
story.content_p2: We are a small team operating from Spain using VPS hosted in Germany, non-profit, with a clear goal: to prove that human ideology has more dimensions than a simple Cartesian plane.
story.quote: Political reality is too complex to fit into two axes.

algorithm.title: The Affinity Engine
algorithm.subtitle: Forget simple averages. We use a Quadratic Decay model to calculate real compatibility.
algorithm.indifference_desc: The system respects apathy. If both users are indifferent, affinity is total (100%). If only one is, we penalize slightly (75%) for the lack of connection.
algorithm.quadratic_desc: Affinity does not drop linearly. We gently penalize small deviations (nuance) but severely punish large differences (conflict).
algorithm.phases_overlap: Contact Phase (50-100%): When tolerance ranges touch.
algorithm.phases_gap: Gap Phase (0-50%): When positions are irreconcilable.
algorithm.aggregation_desc: Axis → Section → Complexity. Affinity is built layer by layer.

guest_prompt.title: First time here?
guest_prompt.subtitle: Let us show you how the Atlas works.

welcome.title: Welcome to the Idea Explorer
welcome.desc: This is the atlas of your ideology where you can define in detail your political and social thinking.

levels.title: Abstraction Levels
levels.desc: These are the different abstraction levels configured for the atlas. As you progress to less abstract levels, the defined ideologies will become more complex and closer to reality.

progress.title: Your Progress
progress.desc: As you advance in your ideology definition, this percentage will increase. Please note that it is independent per level and indicates how much of the *current level* you have completed.

header.title: Level Information
header.desc:
Here you will find detailed information about the abstraction level you are currently in. It is an indicative description.
For now, descriptions have been generated by AI and suggestions are welcome.

sections.title: Sections
sections.desc: In this first level there is only one section, but other levels may have multiple thematic sections.

section_help.title: Section Help
section_help.desc: If you need more information about what a specific section covers, you can find it by clicking here.

axis.title: Ideological Axis
axis.desc: This is an ideological axis. It marks a range of values between which you perceive yourself at this moment. The central ball is your desired value, and the other balls are the maximum position you would be willing to accept on either side.

axis_title.title: Axis Name
axis_title.desc: This is the name of the axis opposing two ideological positions.

axis_help.title: Axis Help
axis_help.desc: If you need help with concepts or explanations of the two terms, here is where you find the context.

axis_indifferent.title: Indifference
axis_indifferent.desc: If an axis is indifferent to you and any value works, you can check this box.

slider_value.title: Set Values
slider_value.desc: You can move the values by dragging the central ball to one side or the other to indicate your ideal position.

slider_margin.title: Tolerance Margins
slider_margin.desc: Each margin is independent. The wider the margin, the more willing you are to accept other positions even if they are not your ideal.

conditioners.title: Conditioning Questions
conditioners.desc: These questions will activate or deactivate certain axes or entire sections. They apply mostly in lower abstraction levels.

complete_level.title: Complete Level
complete_level.desc: Once you have completed a level, you will see the progress at 100% and the bar full.

share.title: Share
share.desc: With this button, you can share your ideological stance with another person so they can explore it.

finish.title: We hope you enjoy it!
finish.desc: You are ready to start defining your atlas.

header_toggle.title: Collapse Description
header_toggle.desc: If the level description takes up too much space, you can collapse or expand it using this button to focus on the axes.
